(6/6) Thank you for your heroism, let’s keep our promise to #BacktheBlue.

(5/6) We have a lot of work to do to get to the bottom of the events that occurred on Jan. 6, but one priority for me is making sure law enforcement officers who bravely kept us safe get the mental health resources they need to process what happened to them and their colleagues.
(4/6) We can’t have folks fighting against defunding the police with one hand and on the other strike them with American flags and fire extinguishers.
(3/6) I stood up against anarchy this summer when our small businesses were burned and looted and officers were harmed. And I stand up against the violent mob who attacked our Capitol last week.
(2/6) The attack on our Capitol displayed horrendous acts of violence against these men and women in uniform. We can and must do better.

(1/6) Our nation’s law enforcement officers—from Capitol Police to local deputies—put their lives on the line every day to protect our nation, our communities, our children, and our families. I am proud to Back the Blue.
